summary: This is an email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors discussing the preparation and review of a draft superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. It references a prosecution memo requesting authorization to charge Maxwell with additional offenses and a scheduled grand jury date.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury for Maxwell Superseding Indictment
events.description: Grand jury time was tentatively scheduled for Monday, March 29, 2021, to consider a superseding indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with additional criminal offenses.

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were actively preparing a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell in March 2021.
A prosecution memorandum requested authorization to charge Maxwell with additional criminal offenses beyond the original indictment.
Grand jury proceedings for the superseding indictment were tentatively scheduled for March 29, 2021.
The email chain shows internal coordination and document review (including a redline comparison) among the prosecution team.
The communication highlights the ongoing legal efforts to expand the charges against Maxwell while adhering to procedural deadlines.
